intro: Meionula parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered meionula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, cool environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
